articles.title: It’s called automated officiating. The NBA is utilizing it to get even more calls right
articles.description: The play, in real time to the naked eye, might have looked very close to a violation. LeBron James leaped, got his right hand on the ball with a few tenths of the game’s final second remaining and tapped it through the basket to give the Los Angeles Lakers a buzzer-beating win last season. articles.title: Houseworks: Boosting real-world door security
articles.description: The lock on your front door might seem strong, but most Canadian homes are just one solid shoulder hit away from unauthorized entry. articles.title: Canadian Museum of History closed due to water supply interruption
articles.description: The closure comes as a result of work currently underway by the City of Gatineau, the museum said.

articles.title: India has agreed to readmit Canadian diplomats, Anand says
articles.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand is in India to discuss a "bilateral relationship" between the two nations amid economic uncertainty and rising geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: Supercharged vitamin k could help the brain heal itself
articles.description: Researchers have synthesized enhanced vitamin K analogues that outperform natural vitamin K in promoting neuron growth. articles.description: Under a revised standstill agreement, Cenovus can acquire up to a 9.9% stake in MEG before the shareholder meeting

articles.title: Ontario still hasn't acted on advice to toughen rules around lead in drinking water
articles.description: 'It's painful to see our authorities not following the evidence when people's health is at risk.' Internal documents show experts supported adopting Health Canada's more stringent guidelines for the toxic chemical back in 2021.
